meanings.definition: A flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things.
meanings.sent1: I packed my lunch in a bag for school.
meanings.sent2: She carried her books in a bag to the library.
meanings.sent3: The bag swung back and forth as the child skipped along.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was a bag of joy that filled the room.
meanings.sent5: The bag bulged with treasures from the beach.

meanings.sent1: She kept her lipstick in her bag at all times.
meanings.sent2: The designer bag matched her outfit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: Her bag seemed to hold an endless supply of tissues.
meanings.sent4: Her bag was a bottomless pit of surprises.
meanings.sent5: The bag dangled elegantly from her arm.

meanings.sent1: The traveler struggled to lift the heavy bag onto the conveyor belt.
meanings.sent2: The bag was filled with clothes for the weekend trip.
meanings.sent3: The bag rolled away from the tired traveler at the airport.
meanings.sent4: His bag was a symbol of his journey through life.
meanings.sent5: The bag bore the marks of many adventures.

meanings.definition: A quantity of game taken in a single hunting trip.
meanings.sent1: The hunter proudly displayed his bag of pheasants.
meanings.sent2: The bag of rabbits was a testament to his skill as a hunter.
meanings.sent3: The bag of ducks quacked softly in the back of the truck.
meanings.sent4: His bag of trophies told the story of his hunting prowess.
meanings.sent5: The bag of game was a trophy of his successful hunt.

meanings.definition: To put something in a bag.
meanings.sent1: I will bag the groceries for you at the store.
meanings.sent2: She decided to bag the apples before they spoiled.
meanings.sent3: He tried to bag the elusive butterfly in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The team hoped to bag a victory in the championship game.
meanings.sent5: She managed to bag a great deal on the sale items.
